Mithril seeds

Advanced data
Item ID299

Mithril seeds are a magical type of seed that can be planted almost anywhere to grow some flowers in the ground. On planting the seeds, the player will move one adjacent square then be given the option to pick the flowers. Picking the flowers produces one of nine different colours of flowers.

A player plants a mithril seed.

40 seeds are awarded upon completion of the Waterfall Quest. Players can buy them at the Legends' Guild.

Mithril seeds are sometimes used to grief players training Hunter and Firemaking, as traps and fires cannot be placed on the same tile as a planted flower. They are also used in PVP, such as in Last Man Standing, as it forces the player to move one tile which can be useful when the player is frozen in place.

Percentages[edit | edit source]

Most of the probabilities in this section are an estimation based on the data of planting 10,000 mithril seeds, except black and white flowers which have been confirmed.[1]

Item Percentage Price
Red flowers 14.08% 62
Blue flowers 15.3% 436
Yellow flowers 14.65% 45
Purple flowers 14.85% 386
Orange flowers 15.39% 267
Mixed flowers 14.66% 83
Assorted flowers 10.78% 477
Black flowers ~0.2% (2/1,001) 67,626
White flowers ~0.1% (1/1,001) 329,386

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Although mithril seeds can be planted underwater in the Mogre Camp and the Underwater Tunnel, players are unable to plant mithril seeds underwater off Fossil Island. Attempting to do so results in the message It's just a little too damp for you to plant your flowers here. appearing in chat. Previously, the text Are you trying to drown your flowers? appeared.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 January 2021
(update)

Mithril seeds can once again be planted in Banks and the Grand Exchange on Deadman worlds.

7 April 2016
(update)

It is no longer possible to plant mithril seeds in the Elemental Workshop's upper level.

18 March 2013
(update)

As part of a policy change on unofficial gambling games, flowers planted with mithril seeds now always appear as mixed flowers while planted.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 21 December 2015. (Archived from the original on 30 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Black is 2/1001 while white is 1/1001."
